EmailTemplate.subject: You are invited to an ASA regulatory training - What's Coming Now!
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Join ASA!
Regulatory Update Webex - What What's Coming Now! National FFELP guarantor American Student Assistance® has designed a regulatory update via WebEx. Join us for an in-depth discussion on the anticipated changes that will become effective on July 1, 2008 and preview some other upcoming changes.
Dates and Time:
Friday June 27, 2008 1:00 p.m. – 2:00 p.m. ET Monday June 30, 2008 10:00 a.m. – 11:00 a.m. ET
Course Description:
Our regulatory analysts will focus on any changes that ASA anticipates may impact your day-to-day job responsibilities. This update will cover a broad range of topics based on changes made to Title IV programs as a result of Negotiated Rulemaking, the College Cost Reduction and Access Act, and H.R. 5715 ("Ensuring Continued Access to Student Loans Act of 2008"). (Please note that ACG/Smart Grants and accreditation will not be covered.) Who Should Attend: Any financial aid administrator interested in the most up-to-date information on statutory and regulatory changes that will become effective on July 1, 2008 and how the changes will affect the way you administer Title IV funds.
How You Will Benefit:
Understand how you and your students will be affected by the upcoming changes and begin preparing for changes that are coming in 2009.
How to register or for additional information.
· Register Online at http://www.amsa.com/fap/training · Email: send your name, phone number and enrollment details to training@amsa.com · Phone: call the Training Department at (800) 999-9080, ext. 3099
All of ASA's training events are offered free of charge. Training is considered one of the guarantor's core responsibilities and ASA is dedicated to providing informative and useful training events for our industry colleagues.
Questions If you have any questions, please contact the Training Department, your client manager, or ASA’s Call Center at (800) 999-9080 and select Option 1. The Call Center’s normal hours of operation are Monday through Friday from 8:30 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. ET.
